Package Game

Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
Game.GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends Object
A class which defines a Game Board. Besides mutators, it contains methods for Connect Four game logic, such as adding a tile to a column or checking if a player has won the game.
Author:
Daniel Arefjev

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard(int boardSize)
      GameBoard 1 argument constructor. Calls the initializeBoard() method with a user-supplied value, and the setPlayer() / setLastAiMove() mutators with some default values.
      Parameters:
      boardSize - the width/height of the game board.

  • Method Details

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard(int boardSize)
      A method which creates a 2D array of a specified size, and fills it with GameTile objects. It sets the name of the GameTile objects to the index of the column they're in, adds borders to the GameTile objects, sets them to be opaque so that this doesn't need to be called later in highlightColumn/dehighlightColumn which can be called multiple times per column, whereas this is only called once here.
      Parameters:
      boardSize - the size of the first and second dimension of the GameTile[][] array.

    • loadIcons

      public void loadIcons()
      A method which sets the icons of GameTile objects within a GameBoard object appropriate to their state.

    • setAIStuff

      public void setAIStuff(boolean aiToggle, int aiDifficulty)
      Method to set the AI toggle and AI difficulty of a GameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      aiToggle - a boolean value indicating whether the AI is toggled on or off.
      aiDifficulty - the level of difficulty of the AI.

    • setLastAIMove

      public void setLastAIMove(int lastAIMove)
      Method to set the last AI move in a GameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      lastAIMove - the column last selected by the "AI" player.

    • getLastAIMove

      public int getLastAIMove()
      Method to get the last AI move in a GameBoard object.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the last column chosen by the "AI" player.

    • doAIMove

      public void doAIMove()
      Method which generates a number using different algorithms and calls addTile(), passing in that number as the parameter.

      public GameTile[][] getGameBoard()

      Returns:
      a 2D array of GameTile representing the state of a GameBoard object.

    • highlightColumn

      public void highlightColumn(int column)
      Method which "highlights" a column by changing all background of the tiles to pink.
      Parameters:
      column - the column to highlight.

    • dehighlightColumn

      public void dehighlightColumn(int column)
      Method which sets the background of a column to back to normal.
      Parameters:

    • getLowestAvailableTile

      public int getLowestAvailableTile(int column)
      Method to return the lowest "available" tile in a given column.
      Parameters:
      column - the column to check.
      Returns:
      the tile index - or -1 if none are available.

    • checkForWinner

      public int checkForWinner()
      Method which checks the game board to see if there is a winner or a draw.
      Returns:
      the winning player (0, for no winner/no draw and 3 for a draw.)
